refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para:
Used to contact a Delegation Factory Service and store a delegated
credential. A delegated credential is created and stored in a delegated
credential WS-Resource, and the Endpoint Reference(EPR) of the credential is written
out to a file for further use.

entry.para: Enables anonymous authentication. Only supported with transport security or the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Specifies the server's certificate file used for encryption. Only needed for the GSI Secure Message authentication mechanism.
Debug: To run the client with debug message traces and error stack traces, the -debug flag must be used.
Specifies a client security descriptor. Overrides all other security settings.
Enables delegation. mode can be either 'limited' or 'full'. Only supported with the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Usage: The -help flag prints the usage message for the client.
Sets the lifetime of the client security context. value is in milliseconds. Only supported with the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Sets the proxy file to use as client credential.
Specifies the authentication mechanism. type can be 'msg' for GSI Secure Message, or 'conv' for GSI Secure Conversation.
Specifies the protection level. type can be 'sig' for signature or 'enc' for encryption.
Specifies the Delegtion Factory Service URL.
Sets the proxy file to use as client credential.
Lifetime of delegated credential in seconds. Defaults to 12 hours or 43200.
Specifies authorization type. type can be 'self', 'host', 'none', or a string specifying the expected identity of the remote party.
Filename to write the EPR of delegated credential to.

refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para:
Used to refresh delegated credentials pointed to by the specified
EPR. A new credential is generated and the one previously created by the delegation service
is overwritten.

entry.para: Enables anonymous authentication. Only supported with transport security or the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Specifies the server's certificate file used for encryption. Only needed for the GSI Secure Message authentication mechanism.
Debug: To run the client with debug message traces and error stack traces, the -debug flag must be used.
Specifies an XML file that contains the WS-Addressing endpoint reference. The EPR would be of the delegation resource that needs to be refreshed.
Specifies a client security descriptor. Overrides all other security settings.
Enables delegation. mode can be either 'limited' or 'full'. Only supported with the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Usage: The -help flag prints the usage message for the client.

Specifies the resource key. The name is the QName of the
resource key in the string form: {namespaceURI}localPart, while
the value is the simple value of the key. For complex keys,
use the --eprFile option. For Delegtaion resource, the name will be as specified here and replace delegationResourceKey with the actual key:
-k "{http://www.globus.org/08/2004/delegationService}DelegationKey delegationResourceKey"
Sets the lifetime of the client security context. value is in milliseconds. Only supported with the GSI Secure Conversation authentication mechanism.
Specifies the authentication mechanism. type can be 'msg' for GSI Secure Message, or 'conv' for GSI Secure Conversation.
Specifies the protection level. type can be 'sig' for signature or 'enc' for encryption.
Specifies the Delegtion Factory Service URL.
Sets the proxy file to use as client credential.
Lifetime of delegated credential in seconds. Defaults to 12 hours or 43200.
Specifies authorization type. type can be 'self', 'host', 'none', or a string specifying the expected identity of the remote party.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Create or refresh delegated credentials in a service container. If the -refresh option is specified on the command-line, then the credential associated with an existing DelegationService resource is updated with a new credential. Otherwise, the SERVICE-SPECIFIER is interpreted as a DelegationFactoryService and a new DelegationService resource is created.

refsect1.title: Command syntax
refsect1.para: EPR-FILENAME: Name of file to store EPR of new delegated credential.

entry.para: Set the delegation mode. MODE can be 'limited' or 'full'. The default is 'limited'
Refresh a credential instead of creating a new delegated credential resource.

informalexample.para: Create a new delegated credential resource and store the EPR of the resource in ~/.globus/delegation.epr
